meanings.definition: To use up or consume wastefully.
meanings.sent1: She tends to outwaste food by buying more than she can eat.
meanings.sent2: If we continue to outwaste our resources, we will face shortages in the future.
meanings.sent3: The party outwasted all the snacks within the first hour.
meanings.sent4: His extravagant lifestyle outwastes his income every month.
meanings.sent5: The careless behavior of the tourists outwasted the beauty of the beach.

meanings.definition: To surpass in wasting or exhausting.
meanings.sent1: The marathon runner managed to outwaste his competitors and win the race.
meanings.sent2: If we don't conserve energy, we will outwaste our neighbors and face higher bills.
meanings.sent3: The toddler somehow outwasted his parents' patience in record time.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire outwasted all efforts to contain it, spreading rapidly through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The leak in the pipe outwasted gallons of water before it was fixed.

meanings.definition: To waste away or become exhausted.
meanings.sent1: Without proper care, the plant will outwaste and wither.
meanings.sent2: The old car slowly outwasted, rusting away in the abandoned garage.
meanings.sent3: The battery in the remote control outwasted just when he found his favorite show.
meanings.sent4: Her energy seemed to outwaste as the day went on, feeling more and more tired.
meanings.sent5: The candle outwasted, flickering out in the darkness of the room.
